definition.name: NXcg_triangle_set

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: d
symbol.doc: The dimensionality, which has to be at least 2.

symbol.name: c
symbol.doc: The cardinality of the set, i.e. the number of triangles.

symbol.name: n_unique
symbol.doc: The number of unique vertices supporting the triangles.

definition.doc: Computational geometry description of a set of triangles in Euclidean space.

group.doc: Reference to or definition of a coordinate system with which the qualifiers and primitive data are interpretable.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer which specifies the first index to be used for distinguishing triangles. Identifiers are defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing the identifiers are defined on the interval [identifier_offset, identifier_offset+c-1]. For explicit indexing the identifier array has to be defined.
The identifier_offset field can for example be used to communicate if the identifiers are expected to start from 1 (referred to as Fortran-/Matlab-) or from 0 (referred to as C-, Python-style index notation) respectively.

field.name: identifier
field.doc: Integer used to distinguish triangles for explicit indexing.

group.name: triangles
group.doc: A simple approach to describe the entire set of triangles when the main intention is to store the shape of the triangles for visualization.

field.name: edge_length
field.doc: Array of edge length values. For each triangle the edge length is reported for the edges traversed according to the sequence in which vertices are indexed in triangles.

field.name: interior_angle
field.doc: Array of interior angle values. For each triangle the angle is reported for the angle opposite to the edges which are traversed according to the sequence in which vertices are indexed in triangles.

field.name: center
field.doc: The center of mass of each polygon.

group.name: bounding_box
group.doc: Axis-aligned or (approximate) (optimal) bounding boxes to each polygon.
